abstract: If you brother-in-law wants to slip your son some moola, just make sure it ends up in the right place.
lead_paragraph: Lucy writes: My brother-in-law, Johnny, is a wonderful uncle. Too wonderful, actually. Every time we see him, he slips my son some cash, like a slick gangster. My son is 7. He just leaves the cash around the house. Iâ€™ve told Johnny to stop giving my ungrateful son money, but he says he likes doing it. Can I make him stop?
